intro: Crawfurdia crawfurdioides var. iochroa, commonly known as the blue-flowered crawfurdia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in shrubland and coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has opposite, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The species is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
